channel.title: Need 317 Sound list (.mp3 or .wav) format
channel.description:
Hey all,
Was wondering if someone could please upload the sound effects for client revision 317
Thanks!

item.title: Need 317 Sound list (.mp3 or .wav) format
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Runescape doesn’t play the midi files through any of the systems synthesisers - they have their own software synthesiser in the client (unless I’m drastically misremembering)

Read full topic

item.title: Need 317 Sound list (.mp3 or .wav) format
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:9, topic:542715”]^ That didn’t make sense.

If you look up how midi works it all depends on your sound card. I don’t know why Jagex used it though.[/quote]
Ok. Jagex created their songs for the game into midi files to begin with. I’m not disputing that it will sound different based on each computer, but that was already how it was when Jagex originally implemented it. So in other words it’s not any worse than the original game itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Need 317 Sound list (.mp3 or .wav) format
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

^ That didn’t make sense.

If you look up how midi works it all depends on your sound card. I don’t know why Jagex used it though.

Read full topic

item.title: Need 317 Sound list (.mp3 or .wav) format
item.dc:creator: @xEthanx xEthanx
item.description:
@xEthanx wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:4, topic:542715”][quote author=xEthanx link=topic=661590.msg4422198#msg4422198 date=1398998453]
Why on Earth would you use .mp3 format for music files? .mid are outrageously smaller and they’re what RS songs were created with.
[/quote]
plus they’re already packed in the cache for you :palm:[/quote]
Well depends on the cache I guess, but yeah, some of them come with a lot of the songs I suppose.

[quote=“Mopman, post:5, topic:542715”][quote author=xEthanx link=topic=661590.msg4422198#msg4422198 date=1398998453]
Why on Earth would you use .mp3 format for music files? .mid are outrageously smaller and they’re what RS songs were created with.
[/quote]

Because midi files aren’t music files?[/quote]
Yes. They are. That’s what Jagex originally used for RS songs actually. You can find the RS songs in midi format, you just can’t convert a say, .mp3 to a midi file, it has to be created in .mid format. If he was talking about his own music/sound effects (which he wasn’t) then that’d be a different story.

Mopman:

You can, but they’ll sound different on different machines.

But it will be no different than RuneScape was; that’s my point. Jagex created their songs into midi files… I mean there were like 2000+ songs, of course they had to have them fairly small per song. What I’m saying is, yeah, different OSs may make it sound different, but it will sound no different per OS than it did back in the day. Make sense?

Read full topic
